Division 2. Department of Aging
   
1-2-73.1   Creation, purpose, powers
DIVISION 1. SENIOR SERVICES ADVISORY BOARD OF FREDERICK COUNTY
§ 1-2-70. CREATION; PURPOSE.
   (A)   The Senior Services Advisory Board of Frederick County is hereby
created.
   (B)   The Senior Services Advisory Board of Frederick County advises the
Frederick County Executive, County Council and the Director of the Senior
Services Division on the Division's delivery of a comprehensive and coordinated
plan of services and activities for older individuals.
(1959 Code, § 30-23) (Ord. 02-18-314, 8-6-2002; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014;
Bill No. 18-23, 10-16-2018)
Statutory reference:
   State Department of Aging, see Md. Code Ann., Health Services Article, Title
10
§ 1-2-70.1. ABOLISHMENT OF THE FORMER COMMISSION ON AGING.
   The Frederick County Commission on Aging is hereby abolished.
(Bill No. 18-23, 10-16-2018)
§ 1-2-71.1. APPOINTMENTS; MEMBERS.
   (A)   The Senior Services Advisory Board of Frederick County shall consist
of 11 members who shall be residents of Frederick County and registered voters
in the County.
   (B)   Membership should reflect the diversity of Frederick County residents,
including older minority individuals and older individuals residing in rural
areas who are participants or who are eligible to participate in County
programs assisted by grants issued under 42 USC, Chapter 35, Subchapter III,
Programs for Older Americans.
   (C)   Family caregivers of older individuals, representatives of older
individuals, service providers, representatives of the business community,
providers of health care to veterans and persons who have demonstrated an
interest in the issues of older individuals are also eligible for appointment.
   (D)   At least 50% of the members must be 60 years of age or older.
   (E)   No more than 20% of the members shall be providers of services to
older individuals, adults with disabilities or veterans.
   (F)   Eligibility for appointment as a service provider will be determined
based on standards adopted by the Senior Services Division.
   (G)   In order to ensure representation of the entire County, each Council
District shall have at least 1 representative.
   (H)   Members will be appointed by the County Executive, subject to
confirmation by the County Council. Members serving on the Commission on Aging
when that Commission is abolished will automatically become members of the
Senior Services Advisory Board for the remainder of their existing terms in
office without the need for appointment or confirmation.
   (I)   Members will serve for a 3-year term without compensation. Of the
initial 11 members, 3 shall be appointed for a term that expires in 1 year, 4
shall be appointed for a term that expires in 2 years and 4 shall be appointed
for a term that expires in 3 years.
   (J)   Members may be reappointed, but may not serve more than 2 full 3-year
terms.
   (K)   Vacancies occurring at any time should be filled for the remainder of
the unexpired term with a person with the same or similar background of the
member being replaced.
(1959 Code, § 30-23, 30-24) (Ord. 02-18-314, 8-6-2002; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-
2014; Bill No. 18-23, 10-16-2018)
§ 1-2-71.2. EX OFFICIO MEMBERS.
   Ex officio non-voting members shall include the Director and selected staff
members of the Senior Services Division, the Director of the County Department
of Social Services, the County Health Department Health Officer and elected
officials from the county or municipalities in the county.
(Ord. 02-18-314, 8-6-2002; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014; Bill No. 18-23, 10-16-
2018)
§ 1-2-72. CHAIRPERSON AND VICE-CHAIRPERSON.
   The Chairperson and Vice-Chairperson of the Senior Services Advisory Board
of Frederick County shall be elected by the members.
(1959 Code, § 30-24, 30-25A) (Res. 77-14, 9-13-1977; Ord. 02-18-314, 8-6-2002;
Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014; Bill No. 18-23, 10-16-2018)
§ 1-2-73. POWERS AND DUTIES.
   The Senior Services Advisory Board of Frederick County shall serve as an
advisory council to the Senior Services Division as defined in the Older
Americans Act of 1965, 42 USC § 3026(a)(6)(D), as amended, and advise the
Director of the Senior Services Division on issues and decisions related to the
services of the Division. The Board may also make recommendations for action to
the County Executive and County Council.
(1959 Code, § 30-25) (Ord. 02-18-314, 8-6-2002; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014;
Bill No. 18-23, 10-16-2018)
DIVISION 2. DEPARTMENT OF AGING
§ 1-2-73.1. CREATION, PURPOSE, POWERS.
   (A)   There is hereby established a Frederick County Department of Aging
which has the responsibility of administering programs and activities as
approved by the county.
   (B)   The Frederick County Department of Aging is an area agency on aging as
defined in Md. Code Ann., Health Services Article § 10-101 and is the local
agency designated by the Maryland Department of Aging, pursuant to the Federal
Older Americans Act of 1965, (as amended) within a planning and service area,
to administer the delivery of a comprehensive and coordinated plan of social
and other services and activities for the elderly.
   (C)   The Department shall have the authority and responsibility to create,
implement, administer and cease programs and activities as approved by the
county. The Department shall act pursuant to state and federal laws that direct
and fund services and activities for the elderly. The Director shall meet
regularly with the Frederick County Commission on Aging keeping the members
informed of programs and progress of the Department of Aging, coordinating
activities as appropriate and receiving suggestions from the Commission.
(Ord. 02-18-314, 8-6-2002; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
ARTICLE VI: FREDERICK COUNTY COMMISSION FOR WOMEN (§§ 1-2-74 — 1-2-90)
Section
   
1-2-74   Creation, purpose powers
   
1-2-75   Appointments, members
   
1-2-76   Terms, reappointments, vacancies
   
1-2-77   Executive committee, President
   
1-2-78   Meetings, attendance
   
1-2-79   Budget, funding
   
1-2-80   Compensation
§ 1-2-74. CREATION, PURPOSE, POWERS.
   (A)   There shall be a Frederick County Commission For Women.
   (B)   The Frederick County Commission For Women shall serve the following
purposes:
      (1)   To provide a central agency for the collection and referral of
activities and services of interest to women;
      (2)   To promote a positive image of women by recognizing their
accomplishments;
      (3)   To advocate for the county’s constituency to the legislature, the
judiciary, the executive, the media, and the public;
      (4)   To identify, study, evaluate, and eradicate, as an advocate,
discrimination against all women;
      (5)   To develop and implement programs that will expand women’s
educational and employment opportunities;
      (6)   To strengthen home life by directing attention to critical problems
confronting women;
      (7)   To educate women in the processes of seeking leadership roles;
      (8)   To encourage women to seek political office, either elective or
appointive;
      (9)   To recommend such procedures, programs, or legislation as it may
deem necessary and proper to promote and ensure equal rights and opportunities
for all persons, regardless of their gender;
      (10)   To advise and counsel the residents of Frederick County and all
government agencies on all matters involving the needs of women and especially
those matters relating to discrimination or prejudice on account of gender;
      (11)   To establish priorities and produce a prioritized annual plan;
      (12)   To appoint committees to assist in carrying out any of the
functions and duties of the Commission;
      (13)   To establish, implement, and amend, as necessary, bylaws for the
operation of the Commission.
   (C)   The Commission shall cooperate with other Frederick County departments
and agencies, and other Frederick County departments and agencies shall
cooperate with the Commission.
(Ord. 92-15-050, 7-21-1992; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§ 1-2-75. APPOINTMENTS, MEMBERS.
   (A)   Subject to confirmation by the County Council, the Frederick County
Commission For Women shall consist of 15 members appointed by the County
Executive.
      (1)   The incumbent members of the Frederick County Commission For Women,
as well as the Human Relations Commission, are encouraged to seek out
applicants for vacancies on the Frederick County Commission For Women.
      (2)   The Commission may make recommendations to the County Executive for
appointments to the Commission.
   (B)   The majority of members shall represent diverse interests in the
community. The members shall be registered voters in Frederick County.
(Ord. 92-15-050, 7-21-1992; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§ 1-2-76. TERMS, REAPPOINTMENTS, VACANCIES.
   (A)   The term of office of each of the members shall be for a period of 3
years.
   (B)   Of the initial 15 members, 5 shall be appointed for a term that
expires in 1 year, 5 shall be appointed for a term that expires in 2 years, and
5 shall be appointed for a term that expires in 3 years.
   (C)   Members may be reappointed, but may not serve more than 2 full
consecutive 3-year terms.
   (D)   Vacancies shall be filled on the same basis as the original
appointments for the unexpired terms. Members shall continue in office until
their successors are appointed and qualified.
(Ord. 92-15-050, 7-21-1992; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§ 1-2-77. EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, PRESIDENT.
   (A)   There shall be an executive committee of 5 members, including the
President.
   (B)   The Executive Committee and President shall be elected at the first
meeting each year by the members of the Frederick County Commission For Women
and shall serve for a 1-year term, but may not serve in excess of 3 consecutive
terms.
   (C)   Vacancies shall be filled on the same basis, by election.
(Ord. 92-15-050, 7-21-1992; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§ 1-2-78. MEETINGS, ATTENDANCE.
   (A)   The Frederick County Commission For Women shall meet monthly at a
Frederick County location which is open to the public and accessible to the
handicapped.
   (B)   The annual schedule for Commission meetings shall be established by
the Commission at the first annual meeting. A calendar of meeting dates shall
be provided to the county governing body at the earliest possible date.
   (C)   Meeting notices shall be part of the public record and shall be
publicized.
   (D)   Special meetings may be called as needed by a majority of the members
in office or of the Executive Committee with 3 business days notice by
telephone.
   (E)   A majority of the members in office shall constitute a quorum for the
transaction of regular business.
   (F)   Any member of the Frederick County Commission For Women who shall fail
to attend at least 50% of the meetings during any period of 12 consecutive
months shall be considered to have resigned, and the President shall forward
the member’s name to the County Executive. Subject to confirmation by the
County Council, the County Executive shall appoint a replacement.
(Ord. 92-15-050, 7-21-1992; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§ 1-2-79. BUDGET, FUNDING.
   (A)   The Frederick County Commission For Women shall prepare and submit to
the county an annual budget to include the recommended appropriation for its
own operation.
   (B)   The county governing body shall determine whether to budget funds for
the operation of the Frederick County Commission For Women.
   (C)   To administer the programs developed by the Frederick County
Commission For Women, it shall secure, in addition to budgeted appropriations,
financial assistance and support from governmental and private institutions.
   (D)   Staff coordination and secretarial services shall be provided by the
citizens services administration as deemed by the County Executive.
(Ord. 92-15-050, 7-21-1992; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§ 1-2-80. COMPENSATION.
   Members of the Frederick County Commission For Women shall receive no
compensation for their services as such, but may be reimbursed for expenses
actually and necessarily incurred by them in the performance of their duties
within the amount made available by appropriation for such purposes.
(Ord. 92-15-050, 7-21-1992; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§§ 1-2-81 – 1-2-90. RESERVED.
ARTICLE VII: FREDERICK COUNTY HUMAN RELATIONS COMMISSION (§§ 1-2-91 — 1-2-100)
Section

1-2-92   Human Relations Department
   
1-2-93   Discrimination contrary to public policy and unlawful

Cross reference:
   Human Relations Commission, see §
2-2-68
Editor’s note:
   Ord. 89-48-579, adopted August 1, 1989, repealed §§ 1-2-91 and 1-2-92, and
enacted §§ 1-2-91 through 1-2-94 in lieu thereof, to read as herein set forth.
The former sections pertained to the human relations council and were derived
from Code 1959, § 30-19. In order to add the provisions of Ord. 92-15-050 as
Art. VI, former Art. VI was redesigned Art. VII, with the section numbers
remaining the same.
§ 1-2-91. ESTABLISHMENT.
   The Frederick County Human Relations Commission is hereby established.
(Ord. 89-48-579, 8-1-1989; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§ 1-2-92. HUMAN RELATIONS DEPARTMENT.
   (A)   The Frederick County Human Relations Department is hereby established
as a department within Frederick County government.
   (B)   The Human Relations Department shall have an Executive Director and
such other employees as the County Executive may approve.
(Ord. 89-48-579, 8-1-1989; Ord. 05-26-387, 10-11-2005; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-
2014)
§ 1-2-93. DISCRIMINATION CONTRARY TO PUBLIC POLICY AND UNLAWFUL.
   (A)   Discrimination based upon race, color, religion, national origin, sex,
age, marital status, disability, familial status, gender identity, sexual
orientation, or source of income is contrary to the public policy of Frederick
County.
   (B)   Discrimination based upon the following is unlawful in Frederick
County:
      (1)   Race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status,
gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability in employment, housing, or
public accommodations,
      (2)   Familial status in housing or employment, and
      (3)   Source of income in housing.
   (C)   “Discrimination” means any act that is unlawful under Federal or State
law based upon race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital
status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability. “Discrimination”
also means acts that are unlawful under Federal or State law based upon
familial status in housing or employment or source of income in housing.
   (D)   “Disability” has the same meaning as the term “physical or mental
handicap” in Article V of Chapter 2-2 of the County Code.
   (E)   “Gender identity” has the same meaning as defined in Md. Code Ann.,
State Government Article, § 20-101.
   (F)   “Sexual orientation” has the same meaning as defined in Md. Code Ann.,
State Government Article, § 20-101.
(Ord. 89-48-579, 8-1-1989; Ord. 09-09-513, 4-21-2009; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-
2014; Bill No. 19-07, 6-18-2019)
§ 1-2-94. POWERS AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF HUMAN RELATIONS COMMISSION.
   (A)   The Frederick County Human Relations Commission shall have all of the
powers and responsibilities allowed under §
2-2-68 of the Frederick County Code.
   (B)   The specific functions and duties of the Frederick County Human
Relations Commission and Frederick County Human Relations Department shall be
established by resolution of the county governing body.
(Ord. 89-48-579, 8-1-1989; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§ 1-2-95. REMEDIAL RELIEF.
   (A)   (1)   Except as provided in subsections (2), (3), and (4) of this
division, the Human Relations Commission is authorized to provide remedial
relief, including equitable relief and monetary damages.
      (2)   The Human Relations Commission is not authorized by this section
to:
         (a)   Award attorney’s fees;
         (b)   Assess penalties or fines;
         (c)   Create a private cause of action; or
         (d)   Award damages for humiliation or pain and suffering.
      (3)   In employment cases, the Human Relations Commission has powers or
jurisdiction over only employers with 15 or more employees.
      (4)   In public accommodations cases and housing cases, the Human
Relations Commission shall not have powers or jurisdiction in excess of or in
conflict with the powers and jurisdiction described in Md. Code Ann., State
Government Article, Title 20.
   (B)   Subpoenas, decisions, and orders of the Human Relations Commission may
be enforced in the Circuit Court for Frederick County.
   (C)   The Human Relations Department or other party may appeal a decision or
order of the Human Relations Commission to the Circuit Court for Frederick
County in accordance with Title 7, Chapter 200 of the Maryland Rules.
   (D)   The Human Relations Commission may be a party to an appeal made to the
Circuit Court for Frederick County.
   (E)   In employment cases, an award of monetary damages:
      (1)   May not exceed a 36-month period; and
      (2)   Shall be reduced by any earnings received during that period or any
amounts earnable during that period with reasonable diligence by the employee
discriminated against.
   (F)   In public accommodations cases and housing cases, an award of relief
is restricted to actual monetary damages and equitable relief.
(Ord. 03-20-343, 12-16-2003; Ord. 14-23-678, 11-13-2014)
§§ 1-2-96 – 1-2-100. RESERVED.
ARTICLE VIII: GAMING (§§ 1-2-101 — 1-2-120)
Section

1-2-102   Definitions
